text: A phrase has a positive semantic orientation when it has good associations ( e.g. , " subtle nuances " ) and a negative semantic orientation when it has bad associations ( e.g. , " very cavalier " ) .In this paper , the semantic orientation of a phrase is calculated as the mutual information between the given phrase and the word " excellent " minus the mutual information between the given phrase and the word " poor " .
